alert.note: Alert for Boone; Hendricks; Marion (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 8:28PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Hendricks, northwestern Marion and southern Boone Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 825 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms over northwestern Hendricks County, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. These strong thunderstorms will be near... Danville around 840 PM EDT Northwest Indy Metro between 845 PM and 9 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Brownsburg. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 120 and 133. Interstate 74 between mile markers 51 and 73. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
